Line 14: Line 14:
* [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake]] damages buildings throughout the region. The city hall is evacuated after being damaged in the quake.
* [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake]] damages buildings throughout the region. The city hall is evacuated after being damaged in the quake.
* 1998 marked the completion of the renovated plaza.
* 1998 marked the completion of the renovated plaza.
â
* In 2001, the city council commissioned a sculpture for the plaza. [http://www.oaklandnet.com/government/council/reports/04-24-01/Council/221reso.pdf Resolution on Plaza Art]
+
* In 2001, the city council commissioned a sculpture for the plaza from artist [[Bruce Beasley]]. The sculpture, ''Vitality'', was completed in 2002.<ref>[http://www.oaklandnet.com/government/council/reports/04-24-01/Council/221reso.pdf Resolution on Plaza Art]</ref><ref>SF Gate - 2001-02-16 [http://articles.sfgate.com/2001-02-16/news/17584238_1_public-art-obscene-gesture-bruce-beasley Oakland Sculptor Beasley Selected / Panel picks art for City Hall Plaza]</ref>
* In November, 2011, it was reported that Google Maps had been updated to reflect the change to Oscar Grant Plaza. <ref>KQED - [http://blogs.kqed.org/newsfix/2011/11/02/image-google-maps-shows-frank-ogawa-plaza-as-oscar-grant-plaza/ Google Maps Shows Frank Ogawa Plaza as Oscar Grant Plaza] - Nov 02, 2011.</ref>
* In November, 2011, it was reported that Google Maps had been updated to reflect the change to Oscar Grant Plaza. <ref>KQED - [http://blogs.kqed.org/newsfix/2011/11/02/image-google-maps-shows-frank-ogawa-plaza-as-oscar-grant-plaza/ Google Maps Shows Frank Ogawa Plaza as Oscar Grant Plaza] - Nov 02, 2011.</ref>
